task-wr.title: Adding Virtual Routers
task-wr.shortdesc: You can add virtual routers to a tenant using the web administration interface or the CLI.

context.p: To add a router to a tenant, you must be logged in as the user associated with the tenant.

As an alternative to the web administration interface, you can use CLI commands to add a virtual router. First, become the appropriate keystone user. The examples in this section assume you are the admin user.
To create a router from the CLI, use the neutron router-create command. For example:
where router_name is a name assigned to the router.
This example creates a distributed virtual router. If the --distributed option is omitted, the default setting (centralized) is used.

note.p: Only the admin tenant can add a distributed virtual router.

step.cmd: Log in as the user associated with the tenant.

info.p: The following instructions assume that the admin tenant is logged in.

step.cmd: On the Routers page, click Create Router.

stepresult.p: The Create Router dialog box appears.

step.cmd: To add a connection to a tenant network configured for external access, select from the External Network drop-down menu.

info.p: This adds a gateway for the router. Alternatively, you can add a gateway after the router is created. For more information, see .

note.p: The Router Type field is shown only for the admin user. For other tenants, a centralized router is added. The admin user can change this setting on behalf of another tenant after the router has been added (see ).

dd.p: Use the default setting specified on the controller (for a standard HP Helion OpenStack Carrier Grade installation, centralized).

info.p: For more information about these choices, see .

step.cmd: To save your settings and close the dialog box, click Create Router.
